JavaScript Dollar Sign $ Since JavaScript treats a dollar sign as a letter, identifiers containing $ are valid variable names: Using the dollar sign is not very common in JavaScript, but professional programmers often use it as an alias for the main function in a JavaScript library. In the JavaScript library jQuery, for instance, the main function $ is used to select HTML elements. In jQuery $("p"); means "select all p elements".

JavaScript Variables

The dollar sign is treated as a letter in JavaScript names.
